title: SQLBACKUP DATABASE Keyword

metadata.description: Learn about SQLBACKUP DATABASE Keyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Reference

❯
BACKUP DATABASE
The
BACKUP DATABASE
command is used in SQL 
Server to create a full back up of an existing SQL database.
The following SQL statement creates a full back up of the existing database "testDB" 
to the D disk:
Example
BACKUP DATABASE testDB
TO DISK = 'D:\backups\testDB.bak';
Tip:
Always back up the database to a different drive than the 
actual database. If you get a disk crash, you will not lose your backup 
file along with the database.
A differential back up only backs up the parts of the database that have 
changed since the last full database backup.
The following SQL statement creates a differential back up of the database "testDB":
Example
BACKUP DATABASE testDB
TO DISK = 'D:\backups\testDB.bak'
WITH 
  DIFFERENTIAL;
Tip:
A differential back up reduces the back up time (since only the changes are backed up).

Reference

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
BACKUP DATABASE testDB
TO DISK = 'D:\backups\testDB.bak'
WITH 
  DIFFERENTIAL;

BACKUP DATABASE testDB
TO DISK = 'D:\backups\testDB.bak'

# TODO: Complete this line
practice_exercises.solution:
BACKUP DATABASE testDB
TO DISK = 'D:\backups\testDB.bak'
WITH 
  DIFFERENTIAL;

summary: This tutorial covers SQLBACKUP DATABASE Keyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQLBACKUP DATABASE Keyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQLBACKUP DATABASE Keyword and how to apply it in your projects.
